channel.title: Reimagining the Internet
channel.description: Reimagining the Internet is a production of the Institute for Digital Public Infrastructure at UMass Amherst, asking scholars, activists, journalists, and artists what is broken on the internet and how to fix it.
channel.author: Institute for Digital Public Infrastructure
channel.copyright: Copyright Â© 2020 Institute for Digital Public Infrastructure
channel.itunes:title: Reimagining the Internet
channel.itunes:subtitle: An Institute for Digital Public Infrastructure production
channel.itunes:summary: Reimagining the Internet is a production of the Institute for Digital Public Infrastructure at UMass Amherst, asking scholars, activists, journalists, and artists what is broken on the internet and how to fix it.
channel.itunes:author: Institute for Digital Public Infrastructure
channel.googleplay:author: Institute for Digital Public Infrastructure
channel.googleplay:description: Reimagining the Internet is a production of the Institute for Digital Public Infrastructure at UMass Amherst, asking scholars, activists, journalists, and artists what is broken on the internet and how to fix it.

item.title: 01. Welcome to Reimagining the Internet
item.description: Our host Ethan Zuckerman introduces iDPI's new podcast by talking about the need for creating online spaces in the public interest, serving civic good instead of a corporate profit motive. Join us as we interview activists, scholars, journalists, and entrepreneurs reimagining the internet as we know it today.
